tests.sic.rnqt.poisson

Class RnQTCpoisson

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.rnqt.poisson.RnQTCpoisson
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf

    public class RnQTCpoisson
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Poisson process with parameters λ>0. The system faces linear holding and backorder costs with cost rates h>0, p>0 and p2≥0. It also faces fixed costs: fixed review cost per period Kr≥0, and fixed order cost Ko≥0. Finally, there is a constant lead-time for each order being placed equal to L≥0. The control parameters then, are r (the reorder point), Q (the batch size), and T (the review interval). The code below uses the formulae 5-20, 5-22...5-24, 5-27...5-5-29 and 5-33 in the Hadley-Whittin (1963) textbook "Analysis of Inventory Systems".

    Notes:

    • 2021-04-07: fixed a bug in the computation of the holding and back-orders costs (missing parentheses in the computation of terms contributing to the inventory costs)

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2019

    Company:

    1.0

    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
                   java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing Poisson demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed backorder cost as well, and fixed review and order costs controlled by (r,nQ,T) periodic review policy.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - double[] representing r (order up-to), Q (batch size) and T (review period)
        param - HashMap if not null, it may contain value for the Kr parameter
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if the computations go awry, see method evalBoth(x).

      • evalBoth

        Pair evalBoth(java.lang.Object x,
              java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing Poisson demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (r,nQ,T) periodic review policy. It returns in a pair of doubles, both the actual value as well as the value when the order cost Ko is zero, forming a lower bound on the cost function.
        Parameters:
        x - double[] or popt4jlib.DblArray1Vector representing r, Q and T
        param - HashMap // may contain a <"Ko",$val> pair
        Returns:
        utils.Pair // Pair<Double result, Double lowerbound>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if Po is computed outside [0,1] or if any number computed turns out to be Double.NaN.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.sic.rnqt.poisson.RnQTCpoisson <r> <Q> <T> <Kr> <Ko> <L> <λ> <h> <p> [p2(0)]. The constraints on the variables and parameters values are as follows:
        • T>0
        • λ>0
        • p_l>0
        • h>0
        • p>0
        • p2≥0
        All numbers (except r) must be non-negative. The reorder point variable r may take any integer value; the batch size Q may take any positive integer value.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
